level.heading: DENIAL, SUSPENSION, OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE (§ 19-1602)

level.text: 1602.1 The Director may deny an application or suspend or revoke a license if:
The application, or any other document required to accompany thepplication, contains a false statement;
The applicant or licensee, or its officer, partner, or member, has ariminal conviction that, considering its age and severity, bears on theiritness to operate a public hall;

The activities at the public hall or associated with the public hall havereated or will create a nuisance or a threat to the public health, publicafety, or the peace, order, or quiet of the surrounding community;

The activities at the public hall or associated with the public hall havead or will have a significant adverse effect on the residential parking needsnd vehicular and pedestrian safety of the surrounding neighborhood;
The building violates District zoning, building, or fire safety statutes oregulations;
The applicant or licensee has allowed or failed to prevent illegal activityrom occurring at a public hall; or
The applicant or licensee has failed to take reasonable steps to preventiolence or any other nuisance from occurring at a public hall or in theurrounding community.
1602.2 An appeal from the denial, suspension, or revocation of a license may beiled with the Office of Administrative Hearings in accordance with its rules ofrocedure.
